article: When learning new vocabulary, don't just memorize a list of words. Instead, try to  _  five sentences using each new word. Then use the new word as often as you can  the first  day you learn it. This  _  you will remember new words much longer. Practising sounds, you know, is  _  --the "th" sound for example. Choose words that begin  _  "th" and repeat them over and over again  _  you are comfortable with them. Let's try! This , that , those, them, think, thought, through, thin.... Read, read, read--in English, of course! Reading is one of the best ways to increase your vocabulary  _  improve your grammar in a natural and fun way. Be  _  to choose topics or books you are interested in. When someone is talking in English,  listen for  the main point. If you hear a word you don't understand, ignore it and go on listening. If you stop and think about the word, you will  _  everything else the person is saying.
